page.title: 15HOUSING IN THEALE
page.content: Most of the housing in the area is concentrated in the south-eastern corner. In the 18th century the village of Theale owed its importance to the coaching industry and there was a decline in its fortunes until the 20th century. The housing in the 3km square centered on 635715 was mostly built in the 20th century, although there are a few 18th and 19th century buildings. A survey of the housing was conducted by Theale Primary School in July 1985. There were 250 owner - occupied houses, 20 houses rented from the local authority and 18 houses rented by Estate workers. 64 houses were detached; 136 semi-detached; 48 were terraced and 42 were bungalows. Houses and their gardens occupied 7% of the total land cover in the 3km block surveyed by the group.
